Class PowerCenter

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Component
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.PowerCenter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PowerCenter extends Component
Represents a power center component in a game board. This class extends the Component class and provides specific functionality related to managing power centers in a player's game board. A PowerCenter manages its coordinates on the game board, interacts with the player's energy state, and allows interaction through visitor-based actions. It implements key operations such as insert, remove, and energy utilization.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PowerCenter

      public PowerCenter()
      Default constructor for the PowerCenter class. Initializes a new instance of the PowerCenter component with default values. This class represents a specific type of component in a game board, managing its position, energy state, and interactions with the player's board.

  • Method Details

    • rotate

      public void rotate(Boolean direction)
      Rotates the component either clockwise or counter-clockwise based on the specified direction.
      Specified by:
      rotate in class Component
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction of rotation. If true, the component rotates clockwise. If false, the component rotates counter-clockwise.

    • controlValidity

      public boolean controlValidity(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerBoard pb, int x, int y)
      Verifies the validity of the specified coordinates (x, y) on the provided player board.
      Specified by:
      controlValidity in class Component
      Parameters:
      pb - the player board on which the validity of the coordinates is checked; must not be null
      x - the x-coordinate to be validated
      y - the y-coordinate to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the specified coordinates are valid on the player board, false otherwise

    • insert

      public void insert(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerBoard playerBoard, int x, int y)
      Inserts the power center into the specified position on the player's game board. This method updates the energy level of the game board, adds the current power center to the list of power centers, sends updates about the tile state, and sets the coordinates of the power center on the board.
      Specified by:
      insert in class Component
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the game board where the power center is being inserted
      x - the x-coordinate of the power center's position
      y - the y-coordinate of the power center's position

    • remove

      public void remove(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Removes this power center from the specified player's game board. Adjusts the player's energy based on the type of the power center and removes it from the player's list of power centers. Sends an update event after removal.
      Specified by:
      remove in class Component
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - The game board of the player from which this power center is being removed. Must not be null.

    • accept

      public void accept(@NotNull @NotNull ComponentAction visitor, @NotNull @NotNull PlayerState State)
      Accepts a visitor, represented by the ComponentAction, to perform an operation on this PowerCenter component. The current state of the player, represented by PlayerState, is also provided to assist in determining the nature of the operation or validating the interaction. This method utilizes the Visitor design pattern to decouple the operations from the components, allowing specific interactions to be implemented in the visitor.
      Overrides:
      accept in class Component
      Parameters:
      visitor - the ComponentAction instance that represents the operation to be performed on this PowerCenter component
      State - the PlayerState instance representing the current state of the player interacting with the component

    • useEnergy

      public void useEnergy()
      Consumes one unit of energy from the PowerCenter. This method decreases the energy stored in the PowerCenter by one unit and notifies the relevant subsystem of the updated state using the Tile.sendUpdates(java.util.ArrayList<org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Goods.Goods>, int, boolean, boolean, int) method. If the energy is already at zero, an InvalidInput exception is thrown to indicate that no further energy can be consumed.
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if the current energy level is zero.

      public int getX()
      Retrieves the x-coordinate of the PowerCenter.
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate of the PowerCenter.

      public int getY()
      Retrieves the y-coordinate of this component.
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate as an integer

    • clone

      public Component clone(PlayerBoard clonedPlayerBoard)
      Creates and returns a new PowerCenter object that is a clone of the current instance. The cloned object will have the same type as the current instance but does not retain references to the original instance's properties, except for the type information.
      Specified by:
      clone in class Component
      Parameters:
      clonedPlayerBoard - the PlayerBoard to which the cloned PowerCenter is associated. Note that this parameter is not directly used in the cloning process but is part of the method's contract structure in the application context.
      Returns:
      a new PowerCenter instance with cloned values.
